snippet: New York’s highest court reviewed three murder convictions in which drivers claimed that their extreme impairment kept them from realizing they were endangering others.
abstract: New York’s highest court is reviewing three murder convictions in which lawyers for the drivers claim their clients' extreme intoxication kept them from realizing they were endangering others; prosecutors, who had argued successfully that drivers Martin Heidgen, Taliyah Taylor, and Franklin McPherson had shown a 'depraved indifference to human life,' counter all three had enough presence of mind to know they were a threat to others but did not care.
lead_paragraph: New York’s highest court reviewed three murder convictions in which drivers claimed that their extreme impairment kept them from realizing they were endangering others.

headline.main: Drivers’ Defense: Too Drunk to Be Guilty
